data.title: List of Singaporean independent films
data.meta_description: The list "Singaporean independent films" has been viewed 0 times.
data.text:
Solos 2007 Singaporean film

0 0

Genre: Drama

Inspired by true events, SOLOS explores relationships among three individuals who are struggling to open up their feelings towards each other... more »

rank #1 · 1

Solos is a 2007 Singaporean drama film directed by Kan Lume and Loo Zihan, written by Loo, and starring Lim Yu-Beng, Loo, and Goh Guat Kian. It is based on a short film by Kan and Loo. The film features no dialogue and recounts the relationships between a boy (Loo), his mother (Goh), and his older lover (Lim). It premiered at the Busan International Film Festival after being pulled from the Singapore International Film Festival when the Singaporean government demanded cuts.

2007 LGBT-related films · 74T

2007 independent films · 124T

2007 drama films · 587T

Be with Me 2005 Singaporean film

0 0

Genre: Drama, Romance

Director: Eric Khoo

rank #2 · 32

Be with Me is a 2005 Singaporean drama film directed by Eric Khoo. The film is inspired by the life of deaf-and-blind teacher Theresa Poh Lin Chan. It premiered as the Director's Fortnight selection in the 2005 Cannes Film Festival. It was also the official entry from Singapore for the 78th Academy Awards in the foreign language category. In December 2005, the Academy body disqualified the film on grounds that the dialogue is mainly in English. Out of 93 minutes, the film only has two and a half minutes of dialogue.

2005 romantic drama films · 68T

2005 drama films · 539T

Films about blind people · 163T

Rubbers 2014 film by Han Yew Kwang

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Romance

When condoms becomes the containers of three tales of love, lust and seduction. more »

rank #4 ·

Rubbers is a 2014 Singaporean sex comedy film written and directed by Han Yew Kwang. It stars Marcus Chin, Julian Hee, Lee Chau Min, Oon Shu An, Catherine Sng, Alaric Tay, and Yeo Yann Yann as Singaporeans who are faced with various problems in their sex lives related to condoms. The film is split into three shorts whose scenes are interwoven. It premiered at the Singapore International Film Festival on December 12, 2014. Golden Village released it theatrically on April 30, 2015, in Singapore, where it grossed $82,510.

2014 comedy films · 445T

2010s sex comedy films · 141T

Singaporean comedy films · 28T

Yao jie huang hou 1995 Hong Kong film

0 0

Genre: Drama

Director: Yonfan

Innocent and naive, the 17-year-old Lian is a maid to a rich family in Malaysia, whose sheltered existence... more »

rank #5 ·

Bugis Street (妖街皇后) is a 1995 Hong Kong-Singapore co-production directed by Yonfan, about the lives of Singaporean transvestites in a bygone era. It was a minor hit at the box office with a sexually-explicit R(A) (Restricted (Artistic)) rating, male full-frontal nudity and its nostalgic evocation of a seedy but colourful aspect of Singaporean culture, prior to the redevelopment of Bugis Street into a modern shopping district and the eradication of transvestite activities in the area.

1995 LGBT-related films · 42T

1995 independent films · 61T

1995 drama films · 344T

15: The Movie 2003 Singaporean film directed by Royston Tan

0 0

Genre: Drama, Comedy

Director: Royston Tan

Fast, frenetic, and furious, 15 is the story of five Singaporian teenagers who, abandoned by the system... more »

rank #6 ·

15 is a 2003 Singaporean coming-of-age black comedy-drama film about teenage gangsters in the Singapore suburbs. Directed by Royston Tan, the film is an expanded version of Tan's 2002 award-winning short film, also titled 15. It is one of the few Singaporean films to feature brief full-frontal male nudity, together with the Singaporean-Thai film Pleasure Factory and the Singaporean-Hong Kong film Bugis Street.

2003 independent films · 71T

2000s teen films · 168T

Films set in Singapore · 90T

A Wicked Tale 2005 Singaporean film

0 0

Genre: Short, Thriller

A Wicked Tale is a thriller based on the story of the Little Red Riding Hood, a tale about manipulation, seduction and innocence lost. more »

rank #7 ·

A Wicked Tale is a 2005 Singaporean experimental short film written and directed by Tzang Merwyn Tong. The film premiered to at the 34th Rotterdam International Film Festival.

2005 independent films · 87T

2005 short films · 60T

Films based on Little Red Riding Hood · 39T

The Naked DJ 2014 Singaporean film

0 0

Genre: Documentary

Chris Ho (X'Ho) a veteran Singaporean DJ, known for his acerbic wit and tattoos, travels to China for the first time to reflect on his Chinese roots ... more »

rank #8 ·

The Naked DJ is a 2014 Singaporean documentary film directed by Kan Lume about musician and political activist Chris Ho, also known as X' Ho. Ho travels to China and reflects on Singaporean culture and politics. The film won the NETPAC Award at the Jogja-NETPAC Asian Film Festival in Indonesia.
